intro: Hieracium sericophyllum, commonly known as the silky hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features finely hairy stems and leaves, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Hieracium sericophyllum is often found in meadows and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils.
